place.name: TOFT NEXT NEWTON
place.gazetteerText: TOFT-NEXT-NEWTON, a parish in Caistor district, Lincoln; 4½ miles W by S of Market-Rasen r. station. Post town, Market-Rasen. Acres, 1,293. Real property, £1,756. Pop., 85. Houses, 15. The property is divided among five. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £280.* Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)

place.name: NEWTON BY TOFT
place.gazetteerText: NEWTON-BY-TOFT, a parish in Caistor district, Lincoln; 3½ miles N N W of Wickenby r. station, and 4 W S W of Market-Rasen. Post-town, Market-Rasen-Acres, 1,004. Real property, £1, 164. Pop., 81. Houses, 15. The property is divided among a few. The manor belongs to P. S. Wilkinson, Esq. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £180. Patron, P. S. Wilkinson, Esq. The church was rebuilt in 1860; and has not a tower. There are a Wesleyan chapel, and charities £15. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
